summary:
• Clashes erupted in Buenos Aires over proposed economic reforms
• Protesters clashed with police in response to the government's plans
• The demonstrations highlighted divisions within Argentine society

• Stranded surfer rescued after spelling out 'HELP' 
• Holly Valance: From Aussie pop star to Trump cheerleader

• The Danish Prime Minister feels like they're not themselves after an attack.
• They admit to feeling different since the incident.
• This admission may impact their ability to lead effectively.

• The far-right has lost its leader due to disagreements with their alliance.
• President Macron claims snap elections show he trusts in democracy.
• Macron criticizes potential alliances between right-wing parties.
• Jordan Bardella, aged 28, represents the French far-right movement.

• Germany considers reinstating mandatory military service amid rising global tensions.
• Reintroduction aims to boost military capabilities in response to European security concerns.
• Potential move seen as crucial step towards strengthening Germany's defense posture in the face of escalating regional conflicts.

• Israel denies responsibility for civilian casualties in Gaza
• Hamas claims Israeli airstrikes killed civilians in Gaza
• Tensions remain high between Israel and Palestine

• The G7 summit is coming to Italy.
• The event will feature seven new ice cream flavors.
• The Pope will also attend the summit.

• Hezbollah launches rocket attacks on Israel in retaliation for killing of senior commander.
• US blames Hamas for prolonging the conflict in Gaza.
• Tensions escalate between Lebanon, Israel, and Palestine over recent violence.

• The military has maintained its professional detachment from politics since 1999.
• A stable government with President Muhammadu Buhari has reduced political instability.
• Democratic institutions have strengthened, making coups less likely.

• The first member of K-pop group BTS has completed their military service.
• They have expressed gratitude to fans by promising 1,000 hugs upon release from duty.
• This marks a milestone in the band's career as they transition back to music after military commitments.

• A bull escaped from a rodeo in Spain.
• The loose bull threw a bystander into the air.
• No serious injuries were reported.

• A heartwarming Thai film is trending on TikTok
• It's leaving viewers emotional and tearful
• Its popularity continues to grow

• The Gaza ceasefire plan is in jeopardy after US claims Hamas has proposed changes.
• The US expands its banking sanctions against Russia amid ongoing tensions.
• A judge dismisses the lawsuit filed by survivors of the Tulsa Massacre.
• The US government considers commuting Hunter Biden's prison sentence.
• US President Biden introduces stricter border control measures, sparking controversy.
• The country sends additional military aid to Ukraine.
• A global survey reveals Joe Biden enjoys higher popularity ratings than Donald Trump.

• A Russian missile attack killed 9 people in Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's hometown.
• The US is supplying Ukraine with advanced military equipment, including drones and artillery systems.
• Ukraine is using American weapons to counter Russian aggression in eastern regions.

• Houthis claim responsibility for attacking a merchant ship in the Red Sea.
• The incident has raised concerns about maritime security in the region.
• The conflict between the Houthi rebels and Saudi-led coalition continues to escalate.
